AODCore.text

Used to render fonts to the screen

Example:
  import AOD;
  Text.Set_Default_Font("DejaVuSansMono.ttf", 13);
  AOD.Add(new Text("Hello, World!", AOD.R_Window_Width()/2, 40));


class Text;
Describes the font, position and text to be rendered to the screen. Uses default font if one is set, but you can also allocate it a different font.
Unlike Entity, this should probably never be inherited from

this(int pos_x, int pos_y, string str_);
Params:
int pos_x Position of the text on the x-axis
int pos_y Position of the text on the y-axis
string str_ message to the rendered to the screen

this(Vector pos, string str_);
Params:
Vector pos Position of the text
string str_ message to be rendered to the screen

void Set_Position(Vector v);


void Set_Position(float x, float y);


Vector R_Position();


void Set_String(string str_);
Sets message to be rendered

void Set_Colour(int r, int g, int b);
WIP (disabled(!))

void Set_Visible(bool t);
Params:
bool t Determines if the text should be rendered to the screen

void Set_To_Default();
Sets font to default font

void Set_Font(string str, int pt_siz);
Sets current font used by this text

string R_Font();
Returns:
String of the font (file location)

ref TextEng.Font R_FT_Font();
Returns:
The Font object

string R_Str();
Returns:
The message rendered to screen

bool R_Visible();


static string R_Default_Font();
